page.title: 15Employment
page.content: The most recent census shows that about 40% of the working population in this area were employers, managers, professional people or non-hand workers. 9% were occupied in farming and the shops, local sevices and businesses also provide some local employment. A large number (54%) travel short distances to work in nearby towns, particularly Harlow, Bishops Stortford, Sawbridgeworth and Stansted while the remainder travel further distances, mainly to London. While the number of local jobs available is higher than in many villages, most of the local people have to travel out of the village to work. In this area we are fortunate to have one of the lowest unemployment levels (about 4\% at present). We found out that 21% of our population is under 16 and 17% are pensioners.
